2.2:
Bienvenue dans Yakuza Kiwami 2!
Mon nom est Kiwami Bob du
Newsletter de conseils.

Je vous expliquerai tous les
détails de base du jeu au
fur et à mesure de votre progression.

N'oubliez pas de revenir ici s'il y a
quelque chose que vous
ne comprenez pas !<symbol=keitai_heart>

13.2:
Ici Kiwami Bob.
Parlons de la sauvegarde du jeu.

Quand vous voulez sauvegarder, mettez
le jeu en pause et sélectionnez Sauvegarder
depuis le menu.

Veuillez noter que vous ne pouvez pas
sauvegarder pendant les combats ou
les événements.

Sélectionnez Continuer depuis l'écran titre
pour retourner dans votre
dernière partie sauvegardée.<symbol=keitai_cat_smile>

14.2:
Ici Kiwami Bob, une fois de plus.
Aujourd'hui, je vais tout vous dire à propos
de la carte.

La minimap affiché dans le
coin en bas à gauche de l'écran de jeu
vous montrera les points
d'intérêts, les ennemis, et les rues
où vous pouvez aller.

Vous pouvez aussi voir la carte entière
de la ville en appuyant sur <symbol=button_touchpad,Default>.

Utilisez les deux cartes en conjonction
pour savoir où vous allez et comment
vous y rendre !<symbol=keitai_cat_smile>

15.1: Vous courrez des marathons en un rien de temps !
15.2:
Ici Kiwami Bob, encore et toujours.
Vous connaissez le sprint ?

Si vous voulez vous déplacer un peu plus
vite, maintenez <action=Action_Run,Default> pour courir.
<symbol=keitai_tension_up> Cependant, vous pouvez pas courir
pour toujours, alors assurez-vous de relâcher <action=Action_Run,Default>
de temps en temps et de reprendre votre
souffle. <symbol=keitai_tension_down>

Vous pouvez améliorer votre endurance
dans le Menu Pause.<symbol=keitai_cat_smile>

16.2:
Kiwami Bob, de retour avec un nouveau
conseil !

Quand vous explorez la ville,
appuyez sur <symbol=button_r3,Default> pour passer dans une
vue première personne.

Vous pouvez même marcher quand vous êtes
en mode première personne !
<symbol=keitai_tension_up> Mais pour que vous sachiez,
 vous retournerez automatiquement
en vue troisième personne
si vous engagez un combat ou commencez une
conversation.

17.2:
It's your boy, Kiwami Bob!
Ever taken a look at the Completion
List from the Pause Menu?

As you complete the items on
this list, you'll gain varying
amounts of EXP. I recommend
you clear some of the easier
tasks first so you can net as
much EXP as possible early on!

You'll unlock new tasks as you
complete other ones, so keep
at it and go for 100%!

18.2:
Ici Kiwami Bob. Vous avez faim ? Moi oui.
Arrêtez-vous dans un restaurant et mettez
de la nourriture dans votre bouche ! <symbol=keitai_meal>

Manger et boire ne vont pas
seulement restaurer votre santé perdue,
mais vous donne aussi un peu d'EXP.
<symbol=keitai_tension_up> Vous pouvez même obtenir de l'EXP bonus
si vous mangez certaines combinaisons spéciales,
donc essayez tout ! <symbol=keitai_cat_smile>

Attention à ne pas trop manger,
cependant. Si vous mangez alors que vous n'avez
pas faim, vous récupérerez de la santé,
mais ne gagnerez pas d'EXP. Promenez-vous
dans la ville et combattez des ennemis
pour être plus affamé ! <symbol=keitai_meal><symbol=keitai_meal><symbol=keitai_meal>

19.2:
Sup, it's Kiwami Bob. Ever looked
up at the sky and thought, "I
wish it wasn't so bright out"?
Well, good news! <symbol=keitai_tension_up>

You can use the waiting room
door in Serena or the sofa in
Aoi to change the time of day.
Keep in mind, some main story
events will keep you from
changing the time.

Use these establishments to
switch between day and night
as you please. Some events
only happen at night, so be
sure to explore at both
times of day! <symbol=keitai_heart>

20.2:
2 Kiwami, 2 Bob here. In case you
haven't noticed, consuming too much
alcohol will get you drunk.
The more booze you drink, the
drunker you'll get.

Sober up by drinking water
or waiting for it to wear
off.

When drunk, more enemies will
bother you around town. <symbol=keitai_cat_sad>
However, you'll fill your Heat
Gauge quicker, so it may be a
good idea to get drunk every
now and again! <symbol=keitai_choki>

21.2:
Tips? Kiwami Bob's got 'em!

As you advance through the
story, you'll come across some
special items called Valuables.
You can see these in your
inventory from the Pause Menu. <symbol=keitai_paa>

Valuables are often important
to the story, so you cannot
sell them or throw them away.

22.2:
More Kiwami Bob spam!

Periodically, you'll receive
Yakuza Kiwami 2 Fun Packs to enhance
your experience!<symbol=keitai_present> Pick them up from 
the package at Serena or Aoi!<symbol=keitai_heart>

You can only receive fun packs once
per save file.

123.2:
Kiwami Bob, back at you!

If you obtain a new outfit,
you can use the waiting room
in Serena or Aoi to change
into it. <symbol=keitai_cat_smile>

Just so you know, you can
only change your outfit in
Premium Adventure! <symbol=keitai_paa>

134.2:
<symbol=keitai_heart><symbol=keitai_heart><symbol=keitai_heart>
Ici Kiwami Bob ! Félicitations pour
avoir fini la Liste des Succès !
<symbol=keitai_heart><symbol=keitai_heart><symbol=keitai_heart>
J'aimerais vous donner une récompense. <symbol=keitai_present>
Rendez-vous au Serena ou à Aoi et
ouvrez le paquet pour le récupérer !
<symbol=keitai_heart><symbol=keitai_heart><symbol=keitai_heart>

145.2:
Welcome to the Yakuza Kiwami 2 demo!
Please note that the contents
of this demo may differ from
the full game. Now, get out
there and have a good time!<symbol=keitai_cat_smile>

2.2:
Dragon of Dojima.

You must be comfortable with
the basics of battle if you
ever hope to survive this
harsh world.

Rush Combo:
<symbol=button_shikaku,Combat> <symbol=button_shikaku,Combat> <symbol=button_shikaku,Combat> <symbol=button_shikaku,Combat>

Finishing Blows:
<symbol=button_shikaku,Combat> <symbol=button_sankaku,Combat>
<symbol=button_shikaku,Combat> <symbol=button_shikaku,Combat> <symbol=button_sankaku,Combat>
<symbol=button_shikaku,Combat> <symbol=button_shikaku,Combat> <symbol=button_shikaku,Combat> <symbol=button_sankaku,Combat>
<symbol=button_shikaku,Combat> <symbol=button_shikaku,Combat> <symbol=button_shikaku,Combat> <symbol=button_shikaku,Combat> <symbol=button_sankaku,Combat>

Double Finishers:
<symbol=button_shikaku,Combat> <symbol=button_sankaku,Combat> <symbol=button_sankaku,Combat>
<symbol=button_shikaku,Combat> <symbol=button_shikaku,Combat> <symbol=button_sankaku,Combat> <symbol=button_sankaku,Combat>
<symbol=button_shikaku,Combat> <symbol=button_shikaku,Combat> <symbol=button_shikaku,Combat> <symbol=button_sankaku,Combat> <symbol=button_sankaku,Combat>
<symbol=button_shikaku,Combat> <symbol=button_shikaku,Combat> <symbol=button_shikaku,Combat> <symbol=button_shikaku,Combat> <symbol=button_sankaku,Combat> <symbol=button_sankaku,Combat>

Charge Attacks:
Hold, then release <symbol=button_shikaku,Combat>
Hold, then release <symbol=button_sankaku,Combat>

Throw Attacks:
(When near enemy) <symbol=button_maru,Combat> <symbol=button_maru,Combat>
(When near enemy) <symbol=button_maru,Combat> <symbol=button_sankaku,Combat>

That is all.

-Man in Black

13.2:
Dragon of Dojima.

Impenetrable defense is vital
on the path to true might. You
will never know defeat if you
can never be hit.

Strafe around an enemy:
Hold <symbol=button_r1,Combat>

Guard:
Hold <symbol=button_l1,Combat>

Evade enemy attacks:
Choose direction <symbol=button_l_stick,Combat> and press <symbol=button_batsu,Combat>

That is all.

-Man in Black

24.2:
Dragon of Dojima.

At times, the environment
around you will prove useful
in your quest. Use anything
and everything in search of
the secret to battle success.
Remember, attacks will change
depending on what object you
are holding at the time.

Grab object:
<symbol=button_maru,Combat>

Attack:
(After grabbing object) <symbol=button_shikaku,Combat>
(After grabbing object) <symbol=button_sankaku,Combat>

Throw object:
(After grabbing object) <symbol=button_maru,Combat>

That is all.

-Man in Black

35.2:
Dragon of Dojima.

It is time you learn about
weapons. You may equip up to
three weapons at a time via
the Equipment menu.

To use an equipped weapon,
press the button you equipped
it to (<symbol=button_left,Combat>, <symbol=button_up,Combat>, or <symbol=button_right,Combat>). To put a
weapon away, press <symbol=button_down,Combat>.

Weapons you take from your
enemies are not automatically
stored in your inventory. To
store a weapon, press <symbol=button_down,Combat> while
holding it.

Every weapon has durability.
If a weapon's durability runs
out, it cannot be used again
until it is repaired.

That is all.

-Man in Black

46.2:
Dragon of Dojima.

Allow me to explain armor
bonuses to you. Sometimes you
will gain stat bonuses based
on what armor you currently
have equipped.

Names and colors play a large
role in these combinations.
For example, equipping both
the Red Binding and the Red
Gem Bracelet will activate
the Red Blessing bonus.

Be sure to search for new
combinations when you
acquire new armor.

That is all.

-Man in Black

57.2:
Dragon of Dojima.

Landing attacks in battle will
fill your Heat Gauge. Once it
reaches a certain point, you
can use Heat Actions when the
Heat Icon (<symbol=button_sankaku,Combat>) appears on the
screen.

Most weapon types have unique
Heat Actions as well.

Heat Actions are extremely
potent, so be sure to remember
when and where you can use them.

That is all.

-Man in Black

68.2:
Long time no speak, Dragon of
Dojima.

I see you have learned how to
enter Extreme Heat Mode. As a
refresher, it can be activated
by filling your Heat Gauge and
pressing <symbol=button_r2,Combat>.

You will be surrounded by a
blue flame, and your attack
power will increase. You will
also be able to grab objects
normally too heavy for you.

There are also Heat Actions
specific to Extreme Heat Mode.

I look forward to fighting you
soon.

That is all.

-Man in Black

79.2:
Dragon of Dojima.

This is my final message to
you. Your training is not yet
at an end. Raise your stats to
their highest possible levels,
and you will gain the ability
to surpass your limits.

Aim to become the strongest
man in the world.

That is all.

-Man in Black

90.2:
A pleasure to make your
acquaintance, Mad Dog.

It must be boring, only ever
battling street thugs. If you
hunger for opponents with more
of a backbone, go to Children's
Park behind Theater Square.

I guarantee your satisfaction.

93.2:
How are you, Mad Dog?

You must be worried about
being bored once you leave the
vibrant street of Kamurocho.

But do not worry. There will
be strong opponents down in
Sotenbori as well. Simply go
over to the parking lot in
West Shofukucho.

I guarantee your satisfaction.

1.2:
Hey, it seems like you've
been doing it big these days,
but don't let your guard down.

Some boxer's got his eye on
you and is looking for a
sparring match. He's at
<color=red>Children's Park</color> right now.

Whether you accept or run is
all up to you.

2.2:
Whoa, you managed to beat
Knockout Fujiki!? Very
impressive, Kiryu-san! Though
there is another guy who has
you in his sights. Compared to
his brother, he's a bit more
of a musclehead, which means
he also packs a stronger punch.

He's near the <color=red>Hotel District</color>
if you feel like taking on
another challenge.

3.2:
Watch out, Kiryu, there's yet
another guy gunning for you.
They call him "Stealthy
Kurosawa", and just as his
name implies, his specialty
is ambushing. He's over on
<color=red>Senryo Avenue</color> right now.
Oh, and he probably won't
recognize you at first.

4.2:
Hey, looks like you're doing
better than usual, Kiryu-san.
How would I know, you ask?
Well that's because of a
rumor I heard recently that
you've been taking down any
delinquent dumb enough to
face you. Speaking of which,
one of them is looking for
you around <color=red>N Senryo Ave.</color>
I'd avoid going there if
you'd rather have nothing
more to do with them.

5.2:
Did you know? Apparently some
hoodlums were planning on
raiding convenience stores
in the area, but thanks to
you handing them a sound
ass-whooping, they've all
but stopped in their tracks.

They seem to be holding a
grudge against you for that,
so I would avoid going near
the convenience store on
<color=red>W Shichifuku St.</color> if you
don't want to run afoul
of their boss.

6.2:
How've you been, Kiryu-san?
Doing well, I hope. I know
you've been going at it pretty
hard, but watch out. Everyone
you've taken out seems to be
riled up against you—I hear
they've hired a pretty tough
hitman to exact their revenge.

There's an intimidating man
like that in the parking lot
on <color=red>E Taihei Blvd</color>. Do whatever
you gotta do.

7.2:
Hey, how's it hanging in
Kamurocho? During your
absence, some dangerous dudes
have drifted into town. Take
this yakuza for instance: they
call him "Nutjob Natagiri".
He may speak with a silver
tongue, but get on his bad
side, and he lets his fists
do the rest of the talking.

Just so you know, he's in
front of <color=red>West Park</color>. Handle
your business, Kiryu-san.

8.2:
Resolute as always, aren't we?
Putting all the troublemakers
in their place and whatnot.
No wonder Master Komaki
favors you.

As for the rest, there's some
guy who's started calling himself
the "next generation of yakuza."
He's around <color=red>Pink Street</color>, so
why not take a look if you're
feeling up to the challenge?

9.2:
Hey, Kiryu-san. Looks like
you're flying off the handle
like always. Just another day
for the Dragon of Dojima, eh?

As usual, you better watch
your back—A lot of guys
are out to use that rep
against you. Among them, the
most notorious is Genso the
God. I heard he's waiting
for you around <color=red>Suppon St</color>.

Legendary yakuza or not,
you should still stay on
guard if you're going there.

11.2:
Still laying the smackdown
even in Sotenbori, huh? Lol
that's just like you. By the
way, there's someone in the
area who's looking to test
his skills, and he sees you
as the gold standard of
strength. He should be over
by the takoyaki place on
<color=red>E Sotenbori.</color> Why not give
him a run for his money?

12.2:
You still in good shape? 'Cause
I heard there's this so-called
"weapon hunter" over by the
<color=red>Bishamon Bridge in Osaka</color>. His
deal is that he basically
beats up thugs and confiscates
their weapons, and they say
he's real tough. If that's
enough to get your blood
boiling, why not check it out?

Oh, and let me know if you do!

13.2:
Apparently there's this weirdo
posted up at the <color=red>Iwao Bridge</color>,
spouting off some kind of
nonsense about protecting the
city... Maybe he's some sorta
vigilante? Or maybe he's just
full of himself. Either way,
he does exude a certain level
of skill. If beating him up
sounds like a good idea, why
don't you go check it out?

14.2:
Hey, are they still giving
you trouble in Sotenbori?

I guess they're just
thirsty for a piece of
that Kiryu action! Which
reminds me, did you know  
there's a famous fight
lover who hangs around
<color=red>Hogushi Kaikan?</color> You two
might just get along, so
why not go bump fists?

15.2:
Whoa, you actually threw down
with Slayer Nagasawa and
won? Impressive. This time, a
guy who calls himself "The
Breaker" has been looking to
settle his mettle. Despite
how ridiculous that sounds,
he's actually not such a bad
dude. He sort of just...
gets into fights and breaks
things without realizing it.
Right now he's at the <color=red>Wild</color>
<color=red>Jackson in Shofukucho</color>.

16.2:
Hey Kiryu-san, how's that
Sotenbori life! Hate to break
it to you, but there's another
bozo running around who thinks
that he's the coolest dude in
town. He's got a pretty bad rep
too... If you think you can put
him in his place, he's hanging
around the <color=red>Tsuruha Drugstore</color>.

Go show him who's boss!

17.2:
To challenge the fearsome
yakuza of Sotenbori is a feat
of incredible bravery. As expected
of the Dragon of Dojima! 
Stay frosty, though— some
of the yakuza you routed
actually sent an assassin
after you. Not that he'll know
who you are at first glance,
but still. Avoid the top floor
of the building on <color=red>South</color>
<color=red>Shofukucho</color> if you'd rather
slip away from this situation.

18.2:
Tearing it up as usual, I see.

I thought so! A word of
caution, however: there's a
bloodthirsty psycho on the
loose who's been sighted on
the same street as <color=red>Hogushi</color>
<color=red>Kaikan</color>. Even worse, it seems
he's caught wind that you're
in town. Whatever you do next
after hearing this blood-
curdling news is up to you.

19.2:
Hey, seems like you've finally
got it all under control. But
you shouldn't get too
comfortable after I tell you
this rumor I heard. Apparently
there's this "golden samurai"
who kicks it behind the
building on <color=red>West Shofukucho</color>. A
samurai in the middle of the
city? That's some craziness
right there. If there actually
is a guy like that around,
lemme know.

1.2:
Howdy, Kazu-chan. (^^)/

I'm, uh... kinda lost. Over in
some parking lot somewheres.

Least I get to look at all the
spicy young hotties on this here
billboard while I wait.

I'll be here! (^>^)

2.2:
Howdy, Kazu-chan. (^^)/

I'm near some kinda theater
or something. Ain't got a clue
where that Moondust place is.

Think ya can come fetch me?

3.2:
Howdy, Kazu-chan. (^^)/

How ya doing? Scooted my butt
back to Sotenbori. Over near
Bishamon Bridge now.

I'm loving every second of it.
People're so happy, plus ya
get a real good bargain at
the shops!

Why don't ya swing by? You
helped me when I was up in
Kamurocho, so now it's my
turn to be helping you.

Catch ya later!

4.2:
Howdy, Kazu-chan. (^^)/

Ya doing good? Remember how I
was gonna go see that sweet
baby boy Yuya when I was up in
Kamurocho? Well since I didn't,
I'm looking to snag a photo of
the guy or something.

Ya seem to know him. Think ya
can lend me a hand?

5.2:
Hiya, Kazu-chan... Hope life's
good for ya.

Saw an old lady the other day
with her grandkid, eating ice
cream together. Thought maybe
that's what it'd be like if I
had a grandkid. Just ended up
making myself lonely.

I wish I had a grandkid of my
own, but that's impossible.
I mean, I never even had kids.

Anyways, sorry 'bout all the
complaining, Kazu-chan. Don't
mind me. Just an old lady
slowly going senile...

1.2:
Thanks a ton 4 agreeing
2 this!! ^_^ U can call
me Masa, btw. (^o^)/

As 4 the job, I hid a key
under a bench in Public
Park 3.（￣ー￣）

Just snag it and scoot
your butt on over to the
coin lockers. Oh yeah, and
the stuff in the locker is
my little secret~ (^_-)/

2.2:
Hiya! Looks like u got ur
hands on my box~ (*^^*)

Now take it over 2 the
guy in the suit behind
Shine! ￣ー￣

3.2:
Hiya! For your last task, get your
butt over to Kamuro Theater.

Find the guy with the hair, and ask
him how many bells he needs. (^3^)

4.2:
Hiya pal! Sorry for all the fuss.
(*^^*)

It's me, Masa! I was wondering,
how about u and me team up? (^o^)/

1.2:
Hi Uncle Kaz!
The headmistress told me
about your idea for helping
Hayato-kun. Do you remember
the puppy we saved last year?
I was thinking maybe we
could find him and bring
him to Sunflower. What do
you think?

2.2:
Hi Uncle Kaz!
Thanks for finding Pochi
for me! Hayato-kun loves
dogs. He already took
Pochi for a walk!

3.2:
Hiya Uncle Kaz!
The roof's fixed! All the
kids are really thankful
for what you did for them,
so they sent you a letter!
I think Suenaga-san has it.

4.2:
Hiya Uncle Kaz!
They just finished building
a playground at Sunflower!
Suenaga-san gave it to us
as a present. Isn't that
incredible?

I hope it's sunny all the
time!

1.2:
Hiya Uncle Kaz!
The roof's fixed! All the
kids are really thankful
for what you did for them,
so they sent you a letter!
I think Suenaga-san has it.

Hiya Uncle Kaz!
They just finished building
a playground at Sunflower!
Suenaga-san gave it to us
as a present. Isn't that
incredible?

I hope it's sunny all the
time!

Payment Overdue

As of today, your debt repayment
is overdue. If you do not repay
the designated amount within
the next 24 hours, we will be
forced to take more serious
measures.

Amount Owed: 580,000 yen
Account Number: *****
Branch Number: ******

Hello again, sir!

This is Tanabe from Happy
Net Online. Have you come
to a conclusion regarding
your modem contract?

2.2:
What do you wish to do
about your contract, sir?
Please be advised, there
will be quite a large
cancellation fee if you
opt out!

3.2:
This is Happy Net Online!
We will contact you again
soon with further details!

19.2:
Mad Dog of Shimano.

It's been a while since you last
fought, so your perception may
have dulled. To get back in shape,
I've located some powerful foes
with some backbone. Go to
<color=red>Children's Park</color>, <color=red>behind Theater</color>
<color=red>Square</color>, and <color=red>Suppon St.</color> in
Kamurocho. Fight these guys first,
and you should remember the
true essence of the Mad Dog of
Shimano.

20.2:
Looks like new enemies have
arrived. Go to <color=red>Park Blvd</color>,
<color=red>Taihei Boulevard East</color>, and the
<color=red>empty lot in the Champion</color>
<color=red>District</color> in Kamurocho. They'll
all be hungry for a fight.

21.2:
Looks like even stronger foes
have appeared. Go to <color=red>Park
<color=red>Boulevard</color>, <color=red>Senryo Avenue</color>,
and <color=red>N Senryo Ave</color> in Kamurocho.
If you don't prepare well,
then you may end up beaten
instead. Good luck.

28.2:
You must be worried about
being bored once you leave the
vibrant streets of Kamurocho.

Not to worry, I expect there
will be strong opponents down
in Sotenbori as well. Simply
head over to <color=red>E Sotenbori St,</color>
<color=red>the back of the building</color>
<color=red>west of Shofukucho</color>, and near <color=red>Aoi.</color>

I can guarantee you won't
walk out unsatisfied.

29.2:
Some powerful new foes have
appeared in Sotenbori. To find
them, go to <color=red>the parking lot,</color>
<color=red>north of the riverside</color>, as well
as the <color=red>Yokobori Golf Center</color>.

They're basically aggressive
types who can't really justify
their existence outside of
picking fights. What a bunch
of saps!

30.2:
Beware, Majima-san. These next
foes are the last in line and
ready to prove their strength.

They're located <color=red>south of the</color>
<color=red>riverside, near Four Shine</color>, and
<color=red>at the roof of the building on</color>
<color=red>South Shofukucho</color>. As I stated
before, they're most likely
the strongest of the strong,
but I'm sure you can take them
down. Show me the true power
of the Mad Dog of Shimano!

31.2:
Impressive. Well done. With
this, you've defeated all the
powerful foes I set up for
you. As a little something
from me, I've left you a gift
on the counter on the <color=red>second</color>
<color=red>floor of Smile Burger</color> in
<color=red>Sotenbori.</color>

Take it.

1.2:
Apologies for the blind email.
My name is Tsunematsu of the
Kazama Family. This email was
sent specifically to those
of you who were close to the
fourth chairman. We were
interested in presenting a gift
to the chairman in thanks for
his incredible efforts to hold
the clan together in perhaps
its darkest hour. If you concur with
this sentiment and would
be interested in contributing,
please deposit 100,000 yen to
this account at any convenience
store ATM.

Thank you for your gracious
consideration and support.

Sincerely,
Koichi Tsunematsu, Kazama Family

2.2:
Patriarch Majima,

Thank you for your support
of the fourth chairman gift fund.
Response has been positive, and we
are implementing a tiered donation
system. If you wish to
donate at the next tier, please
deposit 1,000,000 yen at any
convenience store ATM.
Thank you for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Koichi Tsunematsu, Kazama Family

3.1:
